result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont Wesley Horne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 521 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to count 4 and to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.

- No driving without a valid driver's license or in the vehicle as a passenger of non-licensed person (individual). 
- No contact with: Walgreens stored located at the following locations: 10800 W. Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI; 7600 W Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI; 7171 North Teutonia Avenue, Milwaukee, WI; 6707 West Hampton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI; 1400 E Brady Street, Milwaukee, WI; 1316 West Forest Home Avenue, Milwaukee, WI.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
- Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to count 3 and to any other sentence.

Defendant Lamont Wesley Horne in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Lamont Wesley Horne in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 3: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 72 MONTHS with 521 days credit CONSECUTIVE to count 4 and to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 36 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.



AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  24 MONTHS with 521 days credit CONSECUTIVE to count 3 and to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, defendant IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No driving without a valid driver's license or in the vehicle as a passenger of non-licensed person (individual). 
- No contact with: Walgreens stored located at the following locations: 10800 W. Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI; 7600 W Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI; 7171 North Teutonia Avenue, Milwaukee, WI; 6707 West Hampton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI; 1400 E Brady Street, Milwaukee, WI; 1316 West Forest Home Avenue, Milwuakee, WI. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $0; 
Restitution is set at $0 (zero); 
All non-mandtory costs waived.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Lamont Wesley Horne in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 3 and Count 4:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  to both counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count 1, 2, 5 and 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 1, 2, 5 and 6  DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI  not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.

Defendant is advised by the Court to comply with all conditions of bail; further he is ordered by the Court to report to court on May 9, 2016 and failure to do so may result in a body attachment being issued.
